clinical_study.brief_title: Short and Mid-term Repeatability of Active Anterior Rhinomanometry (AAR) Measurements in Paediatric Age
clinical_study.official_title: Short and Mid-term Repeatability of Active Anterior Rhinomanometry (AAR) Measurements in Paediatric Age - Rhino-Rep

lead_sponsor.agency: Istituto di Biomedicina e Immunologia Molecolare Alberto Monroy

clinical_study.source: Istituto di Biomedicina e Immunologia Molecolare Alberto Monroy

brief_summary.textblock:
Longitudinal, observational study to assess the short-term (test re-test) and mid-term (within the span of 28 days) repeatability of active anterior rhinomanometry (AAR) measures on 4 parallel groups of children with different rhinitis phenotypes, and 1 group of control (healthy) children.
Secondary objectives are: i) assessing of association between AAR, exhaled FeNO (eFeNO) and nasal FeNO (nFeNO); ii) assessing association between objective measurements (AAR, eFeNO and nFeNO) and subjective measurements (Total 5 Symptom score, T5SS).
The study is intended to obtain useful information for improving rhinitis management.

primary_outcome.measure: Short term repeatability of active anterior rhinomanometry (AAR)
primary_outcome.description: For each individual, it will be calculated the coefficient of variation of 5 measurements of AAR taken within 30 minutes, at baseline.

primary_outcome.measure: Mid term repeatability of active anterior rhinomanometry (AAR)
primary_outcome.description: For each individual, it will be calculated the coefficient of variation of 3 measurements of AAR taken at baseline and then twice more within the span of 28 days (after one week and after two weeks).

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between AAR and oral FeNO
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation coefficients between measurements of AAR and oral FeNO (at each visit the mean of 3 consecutive measurements of oral FeNO is considered)

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between AAR and nasal FeNO
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation coefficients between measurements of AAR and nasal FeNO (at each visit the mean of 3 consecutive measurements of nasal FeNO is considered)

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between AAR (objective perspective) and T5SS (subjective perspective)
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation coefficients between measurements of AAR and total 5 symptom score

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between FeNO (objective perspective) and T5SS (subjective perspective)
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation coefficients between measurements of FeNO and total 5 symptom score

arm_group.description: 10 rhinitis children, sensitized to perennial allergens

arm_group.arm_group_label: Rhinitis children, seasonal allergy, outside season (OSR)
arm_group.description: 10 rhinitis children sensitized to seasonal allergens, observed outside the allergen season

arm_group.arm_group_label: Rhinitis children, seasonal allergy, within season (WSR)
arm_group.description: 10 rhinitis children sensitized to seasonal allergens, observed during the allergen season

study_pop.textblock:
A study population of 40 rhinitis children (10 for each of 4 different rhinitis phenotypes)
attending the outpatient clinic of Pediatric Allergology & Pulmonology (PAP) within the Institute
of Biomedicine and Molecular Immunology (IBIM) of the National Research Council (CNR) of Palermo (IBIM CNR), and a control group of 10 healthy volunteers.
